required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: US Post-Market Surveillance Study of the Surfacer System
clinical_study.official_title: US Post-Market Surveillance Study of the Surfacer* Inside-Out* Access Catheter System (Surfacer System)

brief_summary.textblock: Single arm, observational, multi-center, consecutively enrolling, post-market surveillance study. Treating patients in need of central venous access who have upper body venous occlusions or other conditions that preclude central venous access by conventional methods, and who meet the requirements described in the device labeling.

detailed_description.textblock: Single arm, observational, multi-center, consecutively enrolling, post-market surveillance study. A minimum of 30 patients will be enrolled in the study, all cases to be performed un-proctored at 10-12 sites in the United States, with no site enrolling more than 3 subjects. All patients enrolled will sign an informed consent form for use of their data. Investigators will invite patients who will be treated with the device in accordance with the approved labeling and who met enrollment criteria to join the study.

primary_outcome.description: insertion of the device to facilitate central venous access

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events through 24 hours
primary_outcome.description: no procedural adverse events or peri procedural adverse events

intervention.description: The Surfacer® Inside-Out® Access Catheter System is intended to obtain central venous access to facilitate catheter insertion into the central venous system for patients with upper body venous occlusions or other conditions that preclude central venous access by conventional methods.

study_pop.textblock: Patients in need of central venous access who have upper body venous occlusions or other conditions that preclude central venous access by conventional methods and who meet requirements in the labeling of the IFU.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Subjects have require central venous access and require placement of a central venous catheter.
Has venous occlusive disease and conventional access methods are limited. Subject must be willing and able to give a written consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
Occlusion of the Right femoral vein Occlusion of the Right iliac vein Occlusion of the Inferior Vena Cava Any thrombosis in a vessel that will be crossed by the Surfacer device
